9ot3c.question: The pilot can cancel a preset HDG/TRK by:

options.text: Engaging the NAV mode using the DIR TO
Pushing in the HDG/TRK knob (arming NAV mode)
Disengaging AP/FD
All answers are correct
SRS mode will provide guidance to maintain V2+10 kts (minimum) as a speed reference up to the acceleration  altitude.
SRS mode is available up to 1500 ft AGL
SRS mode will not engage if TOGA is selected.
Any other lateral mode is engaged.
The flight plan is lost or the aircraft enters a flight plan discontinuity.
All answers are correct

iw7vv.question: The descent profile has a repressurization segment. When necessary, this produces a repressurization  rate for the cabin during descent. It is a function of the destination airport altitude and the selected cabin rate  ______________________ .

options.text: (Defaulted to - 150 feet/min but this can be modified)
(Defaulted to - 250 feet/min but this can be modified)
(Defaulted to - 350 feet/min but this can be modified)
The FMA displays 'OP DES'
The managed LVL/CH dot on the FCU goes out
The system arms the ALT mode
All answers are correct

mkiii.question: When ALT is armed, the FMA displays the ALT message on its second line:

options.text: Blue when the target altitude is the FCU selected altitude and magenta if the target altitude is an altitude  constraint.
Blue when the target altitude is the FCU selected altitude and white if the target altitude is an altitude  constraint.
White when the target altitude is the FCU selected altitude and blue if the target altitude is an altitude  constraint.

b26r8.question: The pilot can disengage the V/S mode manually by:

options.text: Pulling or pushing the altitude selector knob
Pushing the EXPED pushbutton or
Initiating a go-around
All answers are correct

t4wlo.question: If FDs are engaged in DES or OPEN DES mode or EXP DES (if installed) and if the pilot does not follow the  FD bars to maintain the commanded descent _______________, (pitch too high and autothrust in IDLE).

options.text: The aircraft accelerates.
The aircraft decelerates.

0q1qe.question: During Climb, the FMGS automatically decreases the vertical speed to maintain VLS when VLS (or VLS-5 if  the speed target is VLS) is reached. The target V/S does not change but is no longer followed.

92d5i.question: The AP/FD common modes on take off are:

options.text: Runway/Runway track associated to SRS vertical modes
ILS approach (LAND) or non-ILS approach (APP NAV FINAL)
Go around track associated to SRS vertical modes.
Only approach and go-around modes

3mgyo.question: With the autopilot on and the aircraft above the glide path, can it intercept the glide path if its trajectory  does not cross the ILS G/S beam?

options.text: Yes
No

qjp49i.question: Is this statement true or false: Autoland is authorized with CAT1 displayed on the FMA

6iku7.question: At what approximate altitude will the FLARE mode be engaged (the precise value is a function of V/S) and  the FMA displays 'FLARE' in green ?

options.text: 70 feet RA
60 feet RA
40 feet RA

be2ap.question: If the autopilot is engaged while you are using the APP NAV/FINAL modes, it disengages automatically

options.text: At 30 feet AGL
At 50 feet AGL
At Missed Approach Point (MAP)
MDA -50 feet

qm6srf.question: When one thrust lever is in the CL detent and the other one out of the detent, which amber message  comes up until both levers are set in the CL detent (only with both engines operative) ?

options.text: LVR MCT
LVR MCT
LVR ASYM

26m1s.question: When the A/THR is armed for takeoff or go around, the FMA displays 'MAN TOGA' (or 'MAN FLX') in _____  to remind the crew that the thrust levers have been positioned properly.

options.text: cyan
white

dr4p8.question: When the AP is engaged, the FMGS sends orders to the FAC to give:

options.text: Yaw damping during approach
Yaw control for runway alignment in roll out mode.
Both answers are correct.

h238g.question: The FMGS automatically strings additional types of legs, when departure or arrival procedures (SID-STARTRANS) are defined. Some of these legs are specific legs. The pilot ______ create these types of legs

options.text: can
cannot

a9klr.question: Two minutes after ALT CRZ engages, if the mach mode is operative, SOFT ALT mode engages. This allows  the aircraft to _______ the target altitude, thereby minimizing thrust variations and reducing fuel consumption.

options.text: deviate ± 75 feet from
deviate ± 50 feet from
maintain
deviate ± 100 feet from

dp1sk.question: Does the FMGS logic allow the crew to modify the course of an ILS when its frequency is identical to the  ILS selected in the F-PLN ?

options.text: does not allow
allows

o8nry.question: The SELECTED NAVAIDS page lists the navaids being tuned by the onside FMGC. Navaids _______ be  modified on this page.

options.text: cannot
can

z4wc4.question: How many minutes does a normal alignment take; and how long does a fast alignment take?

options.text: Eight minutes / 30 seconds
Eight minutes / 20 seconds
Ten minutes / 30 seconds
Ten minutes / 20 seconds

ezw1w.question: For flight planning, the pilot inserts the following into the FMGS via the MCDU:

options.text: The intended lateral trajectory (lateral flight plan)
The intended vertical trajectory, which is a speed and altitude profile (vertical flight plan)
The intended cruise TAS/Mach
The intended lateral and vertical trajectories

8ou2.question: The FMGS computes the aircraft position continually, using stored aircraft performance data and  navigation data. Therefore it can steer the aircraft along a preplanned route and vertical and speed profiles. This  type of guidance is said to be ____

options.text: Managed
Auto
Selected
Protected

u9yqw.question: The use of MCDU allows the flight crew to interface with the FMGC by selection of a flight plan for:

options.text: Vertical trajectories
Speed profiles
All answers are correct

kt611.question: How many FMGS operation modes are available:

options.text: two
three
four

171g.question: The Flight Management and Guidance System (FMGS) provides predictions of flight time, mileage, speed,  economy profiles and altitude

ejdfy.question: INDEPENDENT MODE: The system automatically selects this degraded mode under specific abnormal  conditions (e.g. different database validity on both FMGS´s). Both FMGCs work independently and are linked only  to peripherals on their own sides of the flight deck.

t81r3.question: When one FMGC fails, the corresponding MCDU displays 'OPP FMGC IN PROCESS' in white. The ND on the  side with the failed FMGC may be set to a different range and mode as the other ND.

kn3sy.question: When a pilot enters a RNP that is larger than the published value, one of the following messages is  displayed: 'PROCEDURE RNP is XX.XX', or 'AREA RNP IS XX.XX'. When this occurs, the crew should:

options.text: verify the RNP value that was manually entered.
Use the default value.
None of the above.

v7odu.question: When the GPS function is lost, a 'GPS PRIMARY LOST' message is displayed on the ND and MCDU  scratchpads. The MCDU and ND message can be cleared

mupk7h.question: When GPS primary is active, and either of the FMGC positions deviate from the GPS positions 1 or 2 by  more than ________ of latitude or longitude, then the lower ECAM display unit displays the NAV FMS/GPS POS  DISAGREE amber message and A/C POS

options.text: 0.2 minutes
0.4 minutes
0.5 minutes

dsehf.question: ALPHA FLOOR is a protection that commands TOGA thrust, regardless of the thrust levers' positions. This  protection is available on approach from ?

options.text: Five seconds after lift-off to 100 feet RA
Lift-off to 500 feet RA
Lift-off to 100 feet RA.

lu6g5.question: What does the autothrust system do, if it is active:

options.text: Maintains a specific thrust in THRUST mode
Controls the aircraft speed or MACH in SPEED/MACH mode
Uses ALPHA FLOOR mode to set maximum thrust when the aircraft angle of attack exceeds a specific threshold
All answers are correct
Stabilizes the aircraft around its center of gravity
Acquires and tracks a flight path
Flies the aircraft to an automatic landing or go-around
All answers are correct

nir6mi.question: The ALT mode disengages when any other vertical mode engages.

z4vs1k.question: The SRS mode automatically engages, when the thrust levers are set to the TOGA detent, or the MCT/FLX  detent, if:

options.text: V2 is inserted in the MCDU PERF TO page.
Slats are extended.
The aircraft has been on the ground for at least 30 seconds.
All answers are correct

8t4dl.question: The windshear detection function is operative during takeoff from _________________ and during  approach, from ___________________.

options.text: 3s after lift-off up to 1500 feet / 1500 feet to 50 feet
3s after lift-off up to 1300 feet / 1300 feet to touchdown
3s after lift-off up to 1300 feet / 1300 feet to 50 feet

1aj5d.question: Each IRS computes a mixed IRS/GPS position called the GPIRS position. The FMS selects one GPIRS  position based on a figure of merit and priority. The FMS uses the following hierarchy to perform the selection:

options.text: GPIRS 1, GPIRS 2, GPIRS 3
Onside GPIRS position, GPIRS 3, Opposite GPIRS position
GPIRS 3, Opposite GPIRS position, Opposite GPIRS position
GPIRS 3, Opposite GPIRS position, GPIRS1

1cjev.question: The system displays the EPU to the crew, and compares it with the required navigation performance  (RNP). (multiple answers possible)

options.text: If the EPU does not exceed the appropriate criteria, accuracy is HIGH
If the EPU exceeds the appropriate criteria due to loss of threshold update, accuracy is MED.
If the EPU exceeds the appropriate criteria, accuracy is LOW.
If the EPU exceeds the appropriate criteria, accuracy is MED.

1cjev.explanation: FIXME: this question needs to be fixed. Please Open a PR

e04dh.question: Each FMGC autotunes one ILS frequency

options.text: In the PREFLIGHT or TAKEOFF phase, when the takeoff runway has an associated ILS.
In the CLIMB-CRUISE-DESCENT, APPROACH, or GO-AROUND phase, when the type of approach in the flight  plan is ILS
One DME is linked to the ILS/DME

h6o2p.question:
During ILS approaches the system performs a lateral temporary updating using one of the following  modes:

- IRS-GPS/LOC

- IRS-DME/DME-LOC

- IRS-VOR/DME-LOC

- IRS-LOC

wuz5a.question: Pilots may create via DATA PAGES in the FMGC:

options.text: Waypoints
Navaids
Runways
All answers are correct

3bg9o.question: After takeoff the A/THR will not become active until...

options.text: The thrust levers are placed between CL and IDLE detents
The thrust levers are moved out of the TO/GA or FLEX/MCT detents
The autopilot is engaged
The A/THR pb is manually selected ON

jwdso.question: The Flight Management part of the FMGC controls the following functions:

options.text: Navigation, flight planning and A/THR commands
Performance optimization, A/THR and AP commands
Navigation, flight planning, prediction and optimization of performance
AP and FD commands and flight envelope computation

dyr4r.question: The FMGS has four modes of operation:

options.text: Dual mode, Independent mode, Single mode and Back-up navigation mode
Triple mode, Dual mode, Single mode and Independent mode
Normal mode, Abnormal mode, Emergency mode and Back-up navigation mode
Dual mode, Single mode, Normal mode, Abnormal mode

l9zjg.question: If the flight crew performs an automatic approach without autoland, the autopilot must be disengaged  latest at?

options.text: 200 ft AGL
150 ft AGL
100 ft AGL
80 ft AGL

r4zyrh.question: The autoland red warning flashes in LAND mode when the radio altitude goes below ___ and both  autopilots fail.

options.text: 500ft
300ft
200ft
100ft

0c7nq.question: Which computer provides warnings for low-energy and windshear detection?

options.text: FAC
SEC
SFCC
ELAC

58fush.question: WINDSHEAR detection function is provided by the FAC in takeoff phase in the following conditions:

options.text: From 50 ft RA until 1.500 ft RA
3s after liftoff, up to 1.300 ft RA
5s after liftoff, up to 2.000 ft RA
From thrust setting at takeoff until lift-off

chdct.question: The predicted data for alternates in the FMS are based on:

options.text: A flight at FL100 for an alternate F-PLN distance less than 200NM. Cost index 7
A flight at FL150 or an alternate F-PLN distance less than 300NM. Cost index 0
Flight at FL100 and standard speed (270/M0.76)
A flight at FL100 for an alternate F-PLN distance less than 100NM or flight at FL220 for an alternate F-PLN  length between 100 and 200NM or else at FL310 and with a cost index of 0

m8zjn.question: What happens if you switch off both FDs while one and AP is still ON?

options.text: Both FD are no longer displayed and the AP disengages
The AP remains engaged and the onside FD is still displayed
The AP remains engaged and the FDs are no longer displayed
The A/THR reverts to SPD/MACH mode

d8rn6h.question: The pitch FD bar(s) start to flash permanently. What is the reason?

options.text: The GLIDE SLOPE tracking is out of tolerance
The transmission of the GLIDE SLOPE data was interrupted when in G/S, G/S* or LAND mode above 100ft GND
There was a change of vertical mode
There was a change of lateral mode

acmio.question: While climbing with the V/S mode and autopilot ON, an excessive rate of climb value for the available  engine thrust is set on the FCU. The indicated airspeed will decrease until:

options.text: Vαprot
Vls
Vαmax
Vls +10 kt

pper8.question: SRS mode is engaged. Which statement is correct?

options.text: A speed of V2+10 in normal engine configuration is maintained
A speed of V2 or current speed to max. V2+15 is maintained if an engine failure is detected
A pitch of maximum 18° aircraft nose up during normal T/O or maximum 22.5° aircraft nose up in case of  windshear is maintained
All answers are correct

vmjhn.question: The Flight Management Guidance System (FMGS) contains the following units:

options.text: 2 FMGC, 2 MCDU, 2 FCU, 1 FAC
2 FMGC, 2 MCDU, 2 FCU, 2 FAC
2 FMGC, 2 MCDU, 1 FCU, 2 FAC
2 FMGC, 2 MCDU, 1 FCU, 1 FAC

3ftwc.question: MCDU annunciators (on the top of keyboard): IND (amber). This means:

options.text: The onside FM is failed
The onside FM detects an independent mode of operation while both FM are healthy
The onside FM detects an independent mode of operation while both FM are healthy
Indicates that the Multipurpose Control and Display Unit (MCDU) has failed
Available between 100 and 2000 ft in CONF ≥ 1
Available between 100 and 2500 ft in CONF ≥ 1
Available between 100 and 2500 ft in CONF ≥ 2
Available between 100 and 2000 ft in CONF ≥ 2

c5hdk.question: Each IRS computes a mixed IRS/GPS position called the GPIRS position. Of the three GPIRS positions that  each FMGC receives, the FMS selects one GPIRS position based on a figure of merit and priority. The FMS uses the  following hierarchy to perform the selection

options.text: Onside GPIRS position - GPIRS 3 - Opposite GPIRS position
Opposite GPIRS position - GPIRS 3 - Onside GPIRS position
GPIRS 3 - Onside GPIRS position - Opposite GPIRS position
Onside GPIRS position - Opposite GPIRS position - GPIRS3

s5upk.question: The FMGS has different FM position update modes. Which has the highest priority?

options.text: IRS only
IRS-DME/DME
IRS-GPS
IRS-VOR/DME

lav37.question: The INIT B page of the FMS is available during following flight phases:

options.text: All flight phases
On ground, before engine start
During cruise phase
Only after engine shut down

on4fr.question: The wind direction information displayed on the ND is:

options.text: Magnetic
True
Magnetic and true
Relative to longitudinal aircraft axis

ddpqf.question: What are the indications associated with a LOW ENERGY WARNING ?

options.text: An ECAM message, an AURAL WARNING, a MASTER CAUTION
An ECAM message, a Synthetic voice ”SPEED SPEED SPEED”, a MASTER CAUTION
A sytnhetic voice ”SPEED”, a MASTER CAUTION
A synthetic voice ”SPEED SPEED SPEED” only

feu5e.question: ALPHA FLOOR is a protection that commands ___ thrust, regardless of the thrust levers’ positions. This  protection is available from lift-off to ___ ft RA on approach

options.text: MCT / 100ft RA
TOGA / 100ft RA
MCT / 50ft RA
TOGA / 50ft RA

cqix3.question: During an automatic approach with both autopilots engaged, which FMGC is master?

options.text: FMGC 1
FMGC 2
FMGC 2 as soon as AP2 is engaged
FMGC 1 or 2 alternatively

tj7qe.question: A standard disconnection of the A/THR system

options.text: Triggers a permanent ECAM message and caution light
Triggers a temporary ECAM message and caution light. A single chime sounds
Triggers a temporary master warning light that disappears after 3 seconds
Does not trigger any ECAM indication

3gp6i.question: A non-standard disconnection of the A/THR system

options.text: Triggers a temporary ECAM message and caution light. A single chime sounds
Does not trigger any ECAM indication
Triggers a master caution light and an ECAM message removed only by a flight crew action. A single chime  sounds
There is no such thing as a non-standard disconnection of the A/THR system in the Airbus operational manuals

ii8plh.question: The RETARD mode of the A/THR system:

options.text: Is only available during automatic landing (AP engaged in LAND mode)
Is the mode the A/THR system uses to command the FADEC and ECU channels to unlock and activate the thrust  reversers doors. This mode is not available in flight
Generates a RETARD callout at 40 feet during an automatic landing
Generates a RETARD callout at 30 feet during a manual landing

vbl9g.question: Which statement is correct? The ALPHA FLOOR protection mode of the Flight Guidance system

options.text: Is designed to protect the aircraft against high angles of attack in normal and alternate law. This angle of attack  protection is not available in direct and unusual attitudes law
Commands MCT, regardless of the thrust levers' position
Can be exited by the flight crew by releasing the side stick from the full aft position in normal and alternate law
Is available from lift-off to 100 feet RA on approach
Is not inhibited
Is inhibited between 80kts and 1’500ft after lift-off
Is inhibited between 80kts and lift-off
Is inhibited between 100kts and up to 50ft after lift-off

xrdxj.question: The Flight Guidance (FG) part of the FMGC performs the following functions:

options.text: Autopilot (AP) command, Flight Director (FD) command, Autothrust (A/THR) command
Autopilot (AP) command, Multipurpose control and display unit (MCDU) interface, Autothrust (A/THR)  command
Autopilot (AP) command, Flight Director (FD) command, Multipurpose control and display unit (MCDU)  navigation in vertical and horizontal
Autopilot (AP) command, Aircraft communcations addressing and reporting system (ACRAS) communication,  Multipurpose control and display unit (MCDU) navigation in vertical and horizontal

0lf4l.question: The FAC computes the energy level for the low energy with the following inputs:

options.text: Aircraft Configuration
Horizontal decelration rate
Flight path angle
All answers are correct

un8wej.question: The low energy alert is inhibited when:

options.text: With Landing gear extended
With configurration 2, 3 and Full
TOGA is selected, or below 100 ft RA, above 2.000 ft RA, or Alpha-floor or GPWS alert is triggered, or in  alternate law, or both radio altimeters fail
All answers are correct

i11g1.question: Which statement about windshear detection function of the FAC is correct

options.text: The windshear detection function is provided in all configurations below 1.300 ft RA
The windshear detection function is provided with at least CONF 1 selected and below 1.300 ft RA
The windshear detection function is provided with at least CONF 2 selected and below 1.300 ft RA
The windshear detection function is provided with at least CONF 1 AND gear down selected and below 1.300 ft  RA
Controls: rudder, rudder trim and yaw damper inputs
Computes data for the flight envelope and speed functions
Provides warning for low-energy and windshear detection if these functions are installed
All answers are correct

ldz5g.question: The AMBER Characters displayed in the MCDU are indicating:

options.text: Mandatory data (boxes), Important messages, Constraints only
Mandatory data (boxes), Flight crew action required, Important messages, Missed constraint
Mandatory data (boxes), Flight crew action required, Non modifiable data, Missed constraint
Minor messages, Flight crew action required, Important messages, Constraint

q4jrn.question: The FMS uses the following hierarchy to perform the selection of the GPIRS position:

options.text: 1. Opposite GPIRS position, 2. GPIRS 3, 3. Onside GPIRS position
1. GPIRS 3, 2. Opposite GPIRS position, 3. Onside GPIRS position
1. Onside GPIRS position, 2. GPIRS 3, 3. Opposite GPIRS position
1. Onside GPIRS position, 2. Opposite GPIRS position, 3. GPIRS 3

fwdxv.question: Which statement about FM position computation is correct?

options.text: The FM position update at takeoff is inhibited when GPS PRIMARY is active
The FM position update at takeoff is performed at setting of takeoff thrust even when GPS PRIMARY is active
At takeoff the FM postion update is performed automatically at liftoff

The FM position update at takeoff is performed at setting of takeoff thrust. When GPS PRIMARY is active the  FM compares the actual GPS position with the stored runway threshold position ot of its database and will  generate a MCDU message when the check result is negative

uqlrr.question: When GPS Primary mode is lost:

options.text: The flight crew must enter the RNP value of 3.0NM on the PROG page
The flight crew must periodically (within cruise)/at 10.000 ft (in descent) check the position accuracy on the  PROG page
The flight crew must tune manually VOR´s along ist route to ensure a constant correct positon computation of  the FMGC
The flight crew must use the UPDATE AT function on the CRZ PAGE of the MCDU to ensure a proper FM postion  update

s87sw.question: The flight crew can cancel an offset routing in the FMGC by:

options.text: Perfom DIR TO a waypoint (the next waypoint, for example)
Clear the offset field
Enter a zero value in the OFFSET field
All answers are correct

fwda1.question: Which statement about the TRIP WIND insertion during F-PLN initialization is correct?

options.text: Trip wind function is intended for on-ground predictions only. If it is used for this purpose, the crew should  then enter winds on WIND pages prior to departure.
All answers are correct
The FMGS does not consider the trip wind for alternate predictions
If the wind is inserted on the WIND pages the TRIP WIND field on INIT B page will be dashed

z160xf.question: If the Database of the FM has expired.

options.text: The flight crew has to call the maintenance as the are not allowed to cycle the databases of the FM
Can cycle the database but must never do this in flight as it will erase the primary and secondary flight plans, as  well as the stored data
Can cycle the database (on-ground and in-flight) as long as they can assure they have copied the active fligh  plan to activate it again when the cycle is completed
Cycling of database during flight is not possible (prompt is not displayed during flight

fe5kij.question: Which statement for the interaction between AP/FD an A/THR modes is correct?

options.text: If an AP/FD pitch mode controls a vertical trajectory, the A/THR mode controls the target SPD/MACH
All answers are correct
If an AP/FD pitch mode controls a target SPD or MACH, the A/THR mode controls the thrust
If no pitch mode is engaged, the A/THR mode reverts to controlling the SPD/MACH mode

mvzpi.question: The FDs are removed when the aircraft pitch exceeds ___ ° up or ___° down, or Bank angle exceeds ___°

ts4xy.question: The flight crew can engage AP 1 or AP 2 by pressing the corresponding pushbutton on the FCU if the  aircraft has been airborne for at least:

options.text: 3 seconds
50 ft RA
5 seconds
100 ft RA

Will be active below 200 ft RA and will flash if: Both AP´s fail, difference between both RA greater than 15ft,  Excessive deviationon in/or loss of: LOC (1/4 dot above 15 ft RA) or GLIDE (1 dot above 100ft RA)

Will be active below 100 ft RA and will flash if: Both AP´s fail, difference between both RA greater than 15ft,  Excessive deviationon in/or loss of: LOC (1/4 dot above 15 ft RA) or GLIDE (1 dot above 100ft RA)

Will be active below 100 ft RA and will flash if: Both AP´s fail, difference between both RA greater than 50 ft,  Excessive deviationon in/or loss of: LOC (1 dot above 15 ft RA) or GLIDE (1 dot above 100ft RA)
Will be active below 200 ft RA and will flash if: Both AP´s fail, if one RA fails, Excessive deviationon in/or loss of: LOC (1/4 dot above 15 ft RA) or GLIDE (1 dot above 100ft RA)

l336s.question: The aircraft may deviate from the DES profile while DES mode is engaged if:

options.text: All answers are correct
Unexpected wind conditions are encountered
Anti-icing is turned on
The lateral flight plan is changed

4n2ix.question: The flightcrew can disengage the EXPEDITE mode manually during climb or descent with:

options.text: Pushing the EXPED pb on the FCU
Clear the EXPED CLB mode on the MCDU PERF Page
Pulling or pushing (if the conditions are met) the ALT knob on the FCU
All answers are correct

fhwc4.question: Predictions are computed or displayed on the pages of the temporary flight plan.

q89nag.question: Five different color navigation compass displays (NDs) can be selected: -Arc (map mode), -Compass rose  NAV (map mode), -Compass rose VOR, -Compass rose ILS, -Plan. Information displayed onto these modes uses  aircraft position as a reference.

o238n.question: The pilot uses the thrust levers to do the following: - Manually select engine thrust. - Arm and activate  autothrust (A/THR). - Engage reverse thrust. - Engage the takeoff and go around modes.

4y3sa.question:
The aircraft has two flight augmentation computers (FACs) that perform four main functions:

- Yaw  function

- Flight envelope function

- Low-Energy Warning function

- Windshear detection function

2rqlm.question: The vertical flight plan is divided into the following flight phases. Preflight - Takeoff - Climb - Cruise - Descent-Approach - Go Around - Done. All but preflight and done are associated with speed and altitude profiles.

bow96.question: Below _____, the FMGS calculates ECON CRZ SPD instead of ECON CRZ MACH.

options.text: FL230
FL250
FL270
FL300

dv0rul.question: If the pilot does not fly the flight plan, the MCDU predictions assume that:

options.text: The pilot will fly back towards the flight-planned route.
The pilot will immediately resume flying the FMGC-managed modes.
All answers are correct

zvm91.question: Predictions for alternates are displayed on the ALTERNATES page. They are based on a default cruise  _______, if the airway distance is less than 200 NM. ________________.

options.text: Equal to FL230 / Otherwise, it is FL350
Equal to FL220 / Otherwise, it is FL310
Equal to FL210 / Otherwise, it is FL330
Equal to FL200 / Otherwise, it is FL300
Managed, when the target comes from the FMGS and Selected, when the target comes from the SPD/MACH  FCU window
All answers are correct
Selected, when the target comes from the FMGS
Managed, when the target comes from the SPD/MACH FCU window
When the managed SPD engages.
When the aircraft is on the ground at engine start.
All answers are correct
